channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 2024 Was the Year That Broke College Admissions
item.description: Applicants have more anxiety than ever. Elite schools have more power than ever. Something had to give.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Blinken Meets With Israeli Leaders as Netanyahu Promises Assault on Rafah
item.description: The Biden administration wants Hamas to agree to a cease-fire deal before a new ground invasion.

item.title: Californians are sick of the 'malaise that's plagued' the state, says CEO who plans to build new city in the Bay Area—and he's submitted 20,000 signatures to prove it
item.description: The Silicon Valley-backed campaign to build a green city in the San Francisco Bay Area has submitted what it says are enough signatures to qualify for the November election.

item.title: Biden Is Still Losing. His Campaign Should Stop Acting Like He Isn’t.
item.description: It’s good to have a reality check every few months.

item.title: India’s Master of Nostalgia Takes His Sweeping Vision to Netflix
item.description: Sanjay Leela Bhansali’s films are known for splendor, grandiosity and obsessive attention to light and detail. Will that translate to mobile screens?

item.title: Deliveroo driver bit off customer's thumb—now U.K. government cracks down on account sharing
item.description: Delivery platforms will carry out enhanced checks on riders, as substitute rider Jennifer Roche faces a prison sentence for attacking a customer.

item.title: Florida Abortion Ban Takes Effect, and U.C.L.A. Calls in Police
item.description: Plus, a possible shift on marijuana policy.

item.title: Chinese Scientist Who Shared Covid Sequence Protests Lab Closure
item.description: Professor Zhang Yongzhen had flouted a government ban by disclosing the genome of the Covid virus soon after it emerged in Wuhan in 2020.

item.title: Aston Martin's first quarter earnings drop 34% as it awaits fourth CEO in four years
item.description: The luxury carmaker shipped 945 vehicles in the period, a 26% decline from the prior year, while revenue dropped 10% to $334 million.

item.title: Will Hamas Say No?
item.description: We explain why a cease-fire hasn’t happened.

item.title: Expressway Collapses in Southern China Amid Heavy Rains, Killing 24
item.description: The road gave way in the early morning in an apparent landslide. At least 30 other people were injured, many of them seriously.

item.title: Novo Nordisk's market value of $570 billion is now bigger than the entire Danish economy—creating a 'Nokia risk' for Denmark
item.description: “When you have superpowers, you have super responsibility," says CEO Lars Fruergaard Jorgensen.

item.title: India’s Master of Nostalgia Takes His Sweeping Vision to Netflix
item.description: Sanjay Leela Bhansali’s films are known for splendor, grandiosity and obsessive attention to light and detail. Will that translate to mobile screens?

item.title: He Won by a Landslide. Why Is He Fighting for His Political Life?
item.description: Ben Houchen, a regional mayor in the north of England, faces a close re-election race, partly thanks to the broader troubles of Britain’s Conservative Party.

item.title: Geely-backed Polestar pushes back results for second time in a year, as the Swedish carmaker battles accounting errors
item.description: The EV maker is relying on new models such as the Polestar 4 coupe to bolster sales.
